definition[0]: the right to use an official power to make legal decisions, or the area where this right exists
example[0]: The committee has jurisdiction over all tax measures.
definition[1]: the official right and power to make decisions about something
example[1]: This matter is outside my jurisdiction.
example[2]: The bankruptcy court now has jurisdiction over the companyâ€™s assets.
example[3]: The firm has now become a joint stock company under the jurisdiction of the Russian republic.
example[4]: This matter is now within the jurisdiction of the US courts.
